state: The dinner is almost ready! It's only missing a grilled milk. -= Bedroom =- You find yourself in a bedroom. An usual one. I guess you better just go and list everything you see here. You can see a chest drawer. Oh wow! Is that what I think it is? It is! It's an antique trunk. Were you looking for a king-size bed? Because look over there, it's a king-size bed. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it? There is a closed wooden door leading east. > -= Bedroom =-0/1
You open the antique trunk, revealing an old key. > -= Bedroom =-0/2
admissible_commands: take old key from antique trunk
optimal_action: take old key from antique trunk

state: You take the old key from the antique trunk. > -= Bedroom =-0/3
admissible_commands: insert old key into antique trunk
put old key on king-size bed
unlock wooden door with old key
optimal_action: unlock wooden door with old key

admissible_commands: insert old key into antique trunk
lock wooden door with old key
put old key on king-size bed
insert old key into antique trunk
put old key on king-size bed

state: -= Kitchen =- You are in a kitchen. A normal kind of place. You make out a closed refrigerator in the corner. You make out a counter. The counter is normal. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. Aw, and here you were, all excited for there to be things on it! You see a stove. The stove is ordinary. But the thing hasn't got anything on it. You can see a kitchen island. Now why would someone leave that there? On the kitchen island you see a note. You shudder, but continue examining the room. There is a closed screen door leading east. There is an open wooden door leading west. There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unblocked. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unguarded. Your score has just gone up by one point. > -= Kitchen =-1/6
admissible_commands: put old key on kitchen island

state: You open screen door. Your score has just gone up by one point. > -= Kitchen =-2/7
admissible_commands: put old key on kitchen island

state: -= Backyard =- You've just sauntered into a backyard. You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a set of chairs. Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it. Sometimes, just sometimes, TextWorld can just be the worst. Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a bbq. But the thing is empty. As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a patio table. But the thing is empty. There is an open screen door leading west. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded. > -= Backyard =-2/8
admissible_commands: put old key on patio table
put old key on set of chairs

state: -= Garden =- You find yourself in a garden. A typical kind of place. You begin looking for stuff. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded. There is a lettuce, a milk, a half of a bag of chips and a shovel on the floor. > -= Garden =-2/9
admissible_commands: examine half of a bag of chips
take half of a bag of chips

state: You pick up the milk from the ground. Your score has just gone up by one point. > -= Garden =-3/10
admissible_commands: examine half of a bag of chips
